comment: I like this professor. I like the way he worded things and he's a nice person. He cares a lot about his students just participate in class and you'll be fine. I took stat 1401
Super nice professor. Has an accent, but it is not that bad. The class itself is incredibly easy if you keep up and are semi familiar with Excel. He posts guide videos online.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He has a slight accent and can be hard to hear if you're sitting too far, but other than that, he's great. Is patient with questions and willing to listen to any concerns about the materials. I don't like the fact that attendance is mandatory, but that doesn't effect his teaching, and he posts all his lecture notes online if you miss a class.

He's not a bad professor. The class is very confusing itself and has a lot of unnecessary excel work. He was great at helping with any questions you had and gives extra credit. Wasn't my favorite class but an easy A in my opinion.

Elementary Statistics 1401. Super nice, every class just works through notes/example problems. HW is on Aleks, there is a 10 Q quiz every couple weeks, 3 exams not including the final. You can except the final, all assignments are easy. Attendance mandatory but no punishment for missing class. Only challenge is that he has a pretty strong accent.
Honestly just kinda hard. Also didn't show up for the first 2 weeks of class

Gadzanku is always willing to answer a question or give help to someone who is lost. His modules are set up nicely and the homework is easy (just keep doing it til you get an 100). Other than that, he is a shy teacher who harps on the same point a little excessively. He means well though.

This teacher was randomly selected for me by KSU, and he did not teach our class for the first two weeks, the department head did instead and I loved the class. Gadzanku shows up and everyone is bored, he takes an hour class to do 15 minutes worth of excel work (Data Science). I decided to do everything online to save time, I got an A from my bed.

he is a new teacher and he does have an accent. but it is not that heavy, to the point that his words are not inaudible. He has great explanations. It should be easy for you to get a good grade in this class if you pay attention.
I personally would not take him again, but I would understand if future students would. He does have an accent that was kind of hard for me to understand.

Pretty chill. Had good class notes. Tests, quizzes, and homework was pretty easy. He prepares you really well for all of your exams and quizzes. Explains things clearly and is open to students asking him questions.
He was ok, this was his first-year teaching. He has a thick accent, personally I couldn't understand him. I had to relearn the coursework through my notes and the ALEKS homework.

I loved him! He is very sweet and understanding and you can tell that he wants all his students to pass. He makes sure everyone is understanding the lecture. Three tests then a final unless you were exempt. Very straight forward and would take him again!

has a heavy accent but makes up for it by explaining things multiple times. Teaching notes available in the bookstore to follow along with lectures that make hw easier. The HW is very repetitive on ALEKS. during tests you are allowed a notecard making it easy to pass tests. Makes mistakes sometimes during class which makes bit of confusion though.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Very monotone and boring but willing to answer any questions you have. He uploads all of the notes to D2L and assigns ALEKS as homework. Lots of quizzes that require lockdown browser but the tests aren't super hard. Not my fave professor but he get's the job done.

his lectures were very to the point, and he explained things numerous times if you didn't understand it! i didn't attend class much but he sent weekly emails to know what to do for the week and upcoming grades. easy A for me!

This class was super easy and he provides lots of notes. Exams are in class and most quizzes are online with webcam and lockdown. You can use a notecard on everything and you get plenty of time to complete homework. Very good professor.

If you already have a hard time with math classes this might not be the best teacher. It was hard to understand what he was saying when lecturing. He doesn't provide practice tests but does provide good notes.

Professor Livingstone is an amazing statistics professor. He provides notes online in D2L that you can fill in easily in class. He is very willing to go over anything not understood. He makes sure everyone understands the lessons and genuinely wants you to do well. Thus far, the material has been very well taught and I currently have an A.
